content.title: Institutional Support for Development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce
content.details: The scheme 'Institutional Support for Development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce' was introduced in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India. The scheme is implemented by revising and merging existing two separate schemes - 'Market Development of Tribal Products/Produce' and 'Grant-in-Aid to State Tribal Development Cooperative Corporation for Minor Forest Produce Operation'.
benefits: Developing product designs for the export market
eligibility: Minor Forest produce (Trading and Development) Federations (MFPTDFs)

Other institutions identified for product design, development, export processing, training of tribal producers, patenting and trademark, research, GI certification, and activities ancillary to the above.
documents_required: Details of the authorized share capital of the corporation
Paid up share capital of the corporation
Details of the turnover of the corporation during the last three years
Details of the turnover expected for the current year
Profit/loss during the last three years
Year-wise details of grants received from the Central Government so far under this scheme and UC pending
Copies of annual reports/Balance sheets for the last three years

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the Scheme is to create institutions for the Scheduled Tribes to support marketing and development of activities they depend on for their livelihood.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched in the year 2014-15.

faqs.question: Is it a Central Sector Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a Central Sector Scheme and 100% Grant-in-aid will be provided by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs to Implementing Agencies.

faqs.question: What are the various activities to be undertaken under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The activities include Market Intervention, Training and Skill upgradation, R&D/IPR Activity, Supply Chain Infrastructure Development, Trade Information System, Creating brands for tribal produce/products, and Developing product designs for the export market.

faqs.question: What are the Implementing Agencies?
faqs.answer: Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation (TRIFED), State Tribal Development Cooperative Corporations, State Forest Development Corporations (SDCs), Minor Forest produce (Trading and Development) Federations (MFPTDFs), and other institutions identified for product design, development, export processing, training of tribal producers, patenting and trademark, research, GI certification, and activities ancillary to the above.

faqs.question: How can proposals be submitted under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Implementing Agencies (IA) would be responsible for preparing the proposal and detailed action plan along with budgetary requirements and submitting it to the State Tribal/Welfare Department well in advance.
